player: Ryan Kelly (personal) will be available to play Sunday vs. the Spurs.
Tiago Splitter will miss at least six more weeks with a right calf strain.
Jeremy Lin (hamstring) remains without an official timetable to return.
James Young (right ankle sprain) has been ruled out of Tuesday's game vs. the Jazz.
Tyler Zeller (sinus infection) has been released from the hospital and is questionable for Tuesday's game vs. Utah.
Marcus Smart (gastroenteritis) is listed as questionable for Tuesday's game vs. the Jazz.
Avery Bradley (illness) was not listed on the injury report for Tuesday's game vs. Utah.
Cody Zeller has been placed in the NBA's concussion protocol.
Marco Belinelli (ankle) will not play on Monday vs. the Bulls.
Fred Hoiberg hinted that Dwyane Wade might not be playing in back-to-back sets moving forward.
Kevin Love (illness) was dealing with food poisoning on Monday vs. the Pelicans.
Kyrie Irving (right hamstring tightness) is listed as questionable for Wednesday's game vs. Chicago.
Mike Dunleavy (ankle) has been ruled out for Monday's game against the Pelicans.
J.R. Smith’s thumb surgery was completed on Friday morning and the Cavs announced his "return to play timeline is currently projected at 12-14 weeks."
Chris Anderson suffered a torn ACL in his right knee and will be out for the rest of the season.
Deron Williams (illness) went through shootaround on Tuesday morning and appears to be on track to play Tuesday night vs. Washington.
Andrew Bogut (knee) has volunteered to come off the bench and will no longer start for the Mavs.
J.J. Barea (left leg muscle strain) is not expected to play this week.
Kenneth Faried (lower back pain) will not play on Monday vs. the Warriors.
Darrell Arthur (knee soreness) will not play on Monday vs. the Warriors.
Aron Baynes (left ankle sprain) is listed as questionable for Tuesday's game vs. the Pacers.
Reggie Bullock (knee) is making progress and is approximately two weeks away from returning.

Patrick Beverley (wrist) is now officially out on Monday vs. the Wizards.
The Rockets have confirmed that Clint Capela has a small fracture in his left fibula and will be re-evaluated in approximately four weeks.
Jeff Teague (left ankle sprain) is questionable for Tuesday's game vs. Detroit.
Rodney Stuckey (sore left hamstring) will miss Tuesday's game vs. Detroit.
Chris Paul (hamstring) will not play on Monday vs. the Suns.
Blake Griffin underwent successful arthroscopic right knee surgery on Tuesday, and his timetable to return has been set at 4-6 weeks.
Brice Johnson (back) will not play opening night.
Larry Nance (knee) did some work on a weight-bearing treadmill on Thursday.
Marc Gasol (left ankle) practiced on Monday and is being listed as questionable for Tuesday's game against the Lakers.
Deyonta Davis suffered a torn plantar fascia and will miss 6-8 weeks.
Brandan Wright underwent arthroscopic ankle surgery on Tuesday and is out indefinitely.
Justise Winslow (shoulder) did not travel to Phoenix for Tuesday's game against the Suns.
Hassan Whiteside (right retinal contusion) and Justise Winslow (shoulder) did not accompany the team to Phoenix for Tuesday's game against the Suns.
Coach Erik Spoelstra told the media that he thinks Goran Dragic (back) will Tuesday vs. the Suns.
Josh McRoberts (stress reaction in left foot) is out indefinitely, according to coach Erik Spoelstra.
Dion Waiters (groin) participated in morning shootaround and will be a game-time decision for Tuesday's game in Pheonix.
Nikola Pekovic hinted that he may retire from the game of basketball.
Miles Plumlee (right index finger) will not play on Saturday against the Bulls.
Matthew Dellavedova (right hamstring) will remain on the sidelines for Monday's game against the Thunder, which will result in Malcolm Brogdon earning another start.
Rashad Vaughn (left ankle sprain) said he's likely going to be out a "couple of weeks."
Khris Middleton (torn left hamstring) remains confident he will return this season, although no timetable has been established.
Quincy Pondexter (knee surgeries) is still not close to getting back on the court.
Kristaps Porzingis (Achilles) has been ruled out for Monday's game vs. the Magic.
Cameron Payne (foot) has been assigned to the D-League.
Evan Fournier (heel) is listed as questionable for Wednesday's game vs. the Hawks.

Gerald Henderson (hip) is probable for Tuesday's game vs. the Wolves.

76ers coach Brett Brown said Ben Simmons is "coming along fine."
Damian Lillard (left ankle) will not suit up for Sunday's game against the Timberwolves.
Festus Ezeli (knee) is likely to undergo season-ending surgery.

Delon Wright (shoulder) is back to doing on-court work.
